newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks end 5.06 pct up on technical rebound.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks end 5.06 pct up on technical rebound.

text.p: Thai stocks rallied sharply on Tuesday following a technical rebound and on more carry-over buying from Friday's hefty jump, brokers said.
The SET index surged 24.28 points or 5.06 percent to close at 504.53 on 5.6 billlion baht trade. The SET-50 index rose 2.41 points to 35.88.
"Some foreign funds were buying back shares after a heavy selloff last week. Local investors and mutual funds also appeared to join the bandwagon," said one broker at Nava Finance and Securities.
The broker said the hefty gains posted on Friday also helped spark investor interest to continue buying today.
Thai stocks rose 3.33 percent on Friday after the naming of new finance minister Thanong Bidaya, brokers said, although his appointment was seen as neutral by the market.
Gainers outnumbered losers 236 to 74 with 68 unchanged.
Bank shares which came under selling pressure last week on concern about their low-quality assets and loan portfolios led the market gains and were up eight percent.
Thai Farmers Bank jumped 7.50 baht to close at its daily limit of 82.50. The share was the top active issue with 483 million baht turnover.
Bangkok Bank rose 10 to 119 and Krung Thai Bank gained 2.50 to 28.25.
Blue-chip Siam Cement was up 22 to 398. Telecommunication conglomerate United Communication Industry surged 8.50 to 97.50. -- Anuchit Nguyen (662) 652-0642
